javadoc: VariousChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving multiple conflicts in one panel. Each row that has choices represents the choices for a single conflict. So each row can have multiple radio buttons or multiple check boxes. At least one choice must be made in each row that provides choices before this panel will indicate that all choices are resolved.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.
methods.name: allChoicesAreResolved
methods.comment: Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and 
 made the same choice for every row.
methods.name: allChoicesAreSame
methods.comment:
Returns true if the user made a selection for every conflict in the table and 
 made the same choice for every row.

methods.javadoc: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.
methods.name: clear
methods.comment: Removes header text for this panel and all table/row information.

methods.javadoc:
Adjusts the enablement of the Use For All checkbox based on whether choices have been made 
 for all the conflicts currently on the screen and whether the same choice was made for all 
 conflicts on the screen.
methods.name: adjustUseForAllEnablement
methods.comment:
Adjusts the enablement of the Use For All checkbox based on whether choices have been made 
 for all the conflicts currently on the screen and whether the same choice was made for all 
 conflicts on the screen.

name: VariousChoicesPanel
comment:
VariousChoicesPanel provides a table type of format for resolving
 multiple conflicts in one panel. Each row that has choices represents the
 choices for a single conflict. 
 So each row can have multiple radio buttons or multiple check boxes.
 At least one choice must be made in each row that provides choices before 
 this panel will indicate that all choices are resolved.
